memberdef.definition: typedef int(* ie_hot_replica_fill_fn) (int socket_id, void *dst, size_t dst_size, void *user)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replica_fill_fn

briefdescription.para: Callback signature for fill-mode replica construction.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-like value on failure.

briefdescription.para: First-touch a writable buffer to bias NUMA page placement.

detaileddescription.para: Writes one byte per cache line across the region so the kernel maps pages to the NUMA node local to the current CPU affinity.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort hint that the region will be needed soon.
Best-effort hint that the region will be accessed sequentially.
Allocate a replica buffer and establish locality via first-touch.

simplesect.para: Allocated pointer, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free all allocations owned by a replica set.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, const void *blob, size_t blob_size, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, size_t replica_size, ie_hot_replica_fill_fn fill, void *user, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build_fill

briefdescription.para: Replication of hot weight blobs per socket using first-touch placement.

detaileddescription.para: This module provides utilities to create per-socket replicas of a contiguous "hot" blob so the inference kernel can read memory local to each socket when worker threads are socket-pinned.

Two build modes are supported: 1) Copy mode: replicate an existing source blob via memcpy(). 2) Fill mode: allocate per-socket memory, first-touch it, then let a caller-provided callback populate the replica in-place (preferred for runtime reconstruction paths to avoid cross-socket copies).
Thread pinning is delegated to the topology layer via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(). This compilation unit does not implement pinning itself.
